recipe_name: Scones with marrons glacés and chocolate sauce
author: James Tanner
method: Preheat the oven to 220C/425F/Gas 7. For the scones, place the flour, baking powder and salt into a food processor with the butter and caster sugar. Blend until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Add the milk and blend until the mixture forms a dough.  Turn out the dough onto a floured surface and knead until the mixture is smooth. Roll or pat into a block 2.5cm/1in thick. Using a floured round cutter, cut into five scones.  Press a chestnut into the top of each scone and brush with a little milk.  Place the scones onto a non-stick baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes, or until well-risen and golden-brown. For the sauce, melt the chocolate with the double cream in a mixing bowl set over a pan of just-simmering water (make sure that the bowl does not touch the surface of the water). Stir until melted and well-combined. To serve, dust the scones with icing sugar and drizzle over the hot chocolate sauce.
ingredients: 225g/8oz self-raising flour, plus extra for dusting,  1 tsp baking powder,  ½ tsp salt,  55g/2oz butter,  30g/1oz caster sugar,  150ml/¼ pint milk, plus extra for brushing,  5 roasted chestnuts in syrup,  55g/2oz dark chocolate, melted,  100ml/3½fl oz double cream,  icing sugar, to dust
